alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 02 at 2:01PM MST until March 08 at 8:41PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the St. Joe River...including Calder, St Maries...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From late Thursday night to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Water may be over St Joe City Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM PST Wednesday the stage was 28.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM PST.
